name: Bua Loy Dessert Recipe (Rice Balls in Coconut Milk)
description: This delicious Thai dessert features chewy sticky rice balls and sweet coconut milk.

itemListElement.text: Wash potatoes and taro, slice into small, even-sized pieces. Transfer to a steamer and steam until a fork can prick into it.
itemListElement.name: Wash potatoes and taro, slice into small, even-sized pieces. Transfer to a steamer and steam until a fork can prick into it.

itemListElement.text: Wash pandan leaves and blend with water (see pandan dough ingredients). Afterward, pour the mixture through a sieve and catch the pandan water.
itemListElement.name: Wash pandan leaves and blend with water (see pandan dough ingredients). Afterward, pour the mixture through a sieve and catch the pandan water.

itemListElement.text: TARO DOUGH:In a large mixing bowl, mash the steamed taro.
itemListElement.name: TARO DOUGH:In a large mixing bowl, mash the steamed taro.

itemListElement.text: Add glutinous rice flour and tapioca flour.
itemListElement.name: Add glutinous rice flour and tapioca flour.

itemListElement.text: Mix into a fine substance using your hand.
itemListElement.name: Mix into a fine substance using your hand.

itemListElement.text: Gradually add cold water while kneading into a dough (has a texture similar to clay) that doesn’t stick to your fingers.
itemListElement.name: Gradually add cold water while kneading into a dough (has a texture similar to clay) that doesn’t stick to your fingers.

recipeInstructions.name: SWEET POTATO DOUGH: In a large mixing bowl, mash the steamed sweet potato.

itemListElement.text: Add glutinous rice flour and tapioca flour.
itemListElement.name: Add glutinous rice flour and tapioca flour.

itemListElement.text: Mix into a fine substance using your hand.
itemListElement.name: Mix into a fine substance using your hand.

itemListElement.text: Gradually add cold water while kneading into a dough (has a texture similar to clay) that doesn’t stick to your fingers.
itemListElement.name: Gradually add cold water while kneading into a dough (has a texture similar to clay) that doesn’t stick to your fingers.

recipeInstructions.name: PURPLE POTATO DOUGH: In a large mixing bowl, mash the steamed purple sweet potato.

itemListElement.text: Add glutinous rice flour and tapioca flour.
itemListElement.name: Add glutinous rice flour and tapioca flour.

itemListElement.text: Mix into a fine substance using your hand.
itemListElement.name: Mix into a fine substance using your hand.

itemListElement.text: Gradually add cold water while kneading into a dough (has a texture similar to clay) that doesn’t stick to your fingers.
itemListElement.name: Gradually add cold water while kneading into a dough (has a texture similar to clay) that doesn’t stick to your fingers.

recipeInstructions.name: PANDAN DOUGH: Mix glutinous rice flour and tapioca flour in a large mixing bowl.

itemListElement.text: Gradually add pandan water (from step 1) and knead into a dough.
itemListElement.name: Gradually add pandan water (from step 1) and knead into a dough.

itemListElement.text: Prepare a large flat dish with glutinous rice flour.
itemListElement.name: Prepare a large flat dish with glutinous rice flour.

itemListElement.text: Roll each dough into small balls and place them on the flat dish.
itemListElement.name: Roll each dough into small balls and place them on the flat dish.

itemListElement.text: Then, fill a cooking pot with water and place over high heat. Spoon the sticky rice balls onto a sieve and shake it several times to remove excess flour, then add them to the pot. The balls will float to the top when ready, but I like to let it simmer for 2-3 more minutes to ensure they’re done. Remove them with a sieve and transfer to a large bowl filled with room temperature water to stop the cooking process. Work in small batches, not overcrowding the pot.
itemListElement.name: Then, fill a cooking pot with water and place over high heat. Spoon the sticky rice balls onto a sieve and shake it several times to remove excess flour, then add them to the pot. The balls will float to the top when ready, but I like to let it simmer for 2-3 more minutes to ensure they’re done. Remove them with a sieve and transfer to a large bowl filled with room temperature water to stop the cooking process. Work in small batches, not overcrowding the pot.

itemListElement.text: Place a pot over medium heat and add coconut milk, water, white sugar, pandan leaves, and salt.
itemListElement.name: Place a pot over medium heat and add coconut milk, water, white sugar, pandan leaves, and salt.

itemListElement.text: Bring to a boil and then crack the eggs, cook for 3–4 minutes or until the egg is done. Don’t stir, this will break the egg.
itemListElement.name: Bring to a boil and then crack the eggs, cook for 3–4 minutes or until the egg is done. Don’t stir, this will break the egg.

itemListElement.text: Serve: If serving immediately, add the colorful sticky rice balls to the pot and remove from heat. If making ahead of time or making a large batch with leftovers, keep the sweet coconut milk and the sticky rice balls separate until ready to serve.
itemListElement.name: Serve: If serving immediately, add the colorful sticky rice balls to the pot and remove from heat. If making ahead of time or making a large batch with leftovers, keep the sweet coconut milk and the sticky rice balls separate until ready to serve.

keywords: bua loy, rice balls in coconut milk
